Class InputWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ecosim.InputWriter

  • public class InputWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    Writes input files for Fred's method.
    Author:
    Andrew Warner

    • Method Detail

      • writeFile

        public static boolean writeFile(java.io.File output,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> bins,
                double[] omegaRange,
                double[] sigmaRange,
                int[] npopRange,
                double[] driftRange,
                int[] xnumincs,
                int nu,
                int nrep,
                int lenSequence,
                int jwhichxavg)
        Write the input file for a run of Fred's method, Hill climbing, or confidence intervals. pre - All the input values are formatted properly. post - The input file (usually acinas.dat) for Fred method is written.
        Parameters:
        output - The output file to write to.
        bins - The top part of the input file, ie, the percentage differences such that the sequences fit into more than one bin.
        omegaRange - Must be an array of size 2, containing the range of omega; IE if the range is .001 to 100.0, then omegaRange = {.001, 100.0}.
        sigmaRange - Same as omegaRange.
        npopRange - The range for npop.
        driftRange - The drift range.
        xnumincs - An array of size 4 where the values correspond to those of the xnumics line of input.
        nu - The value of nu.
        nrep - The number of reps.
        lenSequence - The length of the gene sequences.
        jwhichxavg - Used for everything except fred method, the program will not write it if jwhichxavg is -1.
        Returns:
        True if writing the output file was successful, false otherwise.

      • writeFile

        public static boolean writeFile(java.io.File output,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> bins,
                double[] omegaRange,
                double[] sigmaRange,
                int[] npopRange,
                double[] driftRange,
                int[] xnumincs,
                int nu,
                int nrep,
                int lenSequence,
                int jwhichxavg,
                double probThres)
        Write the input file for a run of Fred's method, Hill climbing, or confidence intervals. pre - All the input values are formatted properly post - The input file (usually acinas.dat) for Fred method is written
        Parameters:
        output - The output file to write to.
        bins - The top part of the input file, ie, the percentage differences such that the sequences fit into more than one bin.
        omegaRange - An array of size 2, containing the range of omega; IE if the range is .001 to 100.0, then omegaRange = {.001, 100.0}.
        sigmaRange - The same as omegaRange.
        npopRange - The range for npop.
        driftRange - The drift range.
        xnumincs - An array of size 4 where the values correspond to those of the xnumics line of input.
        nu - The value of nu.
        nrep - The number of reps.
        lenSequence - The length of the gene sequences.
        jwhichxavg - Used for everything except fred method, the program will not write it if jwhichxavg is -1.
        probThres - The probability threshold at which to continue. If the value gets a better probability or to stop if the best hill climbing value at that value of the given parameter is outside of the confidence interval.
        Returns:
        True if writing the output file was successful, false otherwise
